column2:
suffix
  1. denotes a person with a given characteristic, usually colloquial and/or derogatory in nature

suffix
  1. The singular suffix for feminine nouns derived from Hebrew.

pron
  1. (immediately following a second-person singular present tense verb) Alternative form of דו (du, “you”)

suffix
  1. The plural suffix for feminine nouns derived from Hebrew.

suffix
  1. Regular termination of the third-person plural singular indicative form of verbs.
  2. Regular termination of the second-person plural present indicative form of verbs.
  3. Regularly forms past participles of verbs stressed on the final syllable of the stem.
  4. Forms ordinal numbers.

suffix
  1. A suffix used to derive abstract nouns: -dom.

suffix
  1. Sometimes used to form feminine equivalents of masculine nouns.

suffix
  1. The plural suffix for masculine nouns derived from Hebrew.

suffix
  1. Suffixed to animate nouns to create a feminine form

suffix
  1. -ist (one who follows a particular ideology, doctrine, belief system or theory)
  2. -ist (a member of a profession, or someone who uses something)

suffix
  1. -ish, -ic, -y (for an adjective)
  2. -ian (for an adjective)
  3. -ish, -ese (for a language name or demonym)

suffix
  1. Forms diminutive nouns when added to a noun, with umlaut where applicable.
  2. Forms fractional numerals when added to the stem of an ordinal numeral.

suffix
  1. The infinitive marker for verbs, which can be appended to a noun or adjective that means X to create a verb that means "to make X" or "to do X"
  2. A plural marker for regular nouns not ending in an unstressed ־ר (-r), ־ם (-m), ־ן (-n), or a vowel.
  3. Used to indicate the dative and accusative in the masculine form of adjectives and masculine declined nouns, and the dative in the neuter form of adjectives and feminine declined nouns.
  4. Used to form nouns denoting people of a certain profession or who perform certain habitual actions.
  5. Regular termination of the first-person plural present indicative form of verbs.
  6. Regular termination of the third-person plural present indicative form of verbs.

suffix
  1. (added to nouns) -nik, -er: Denoting persons by membership, occupation or attribute.

suffix
  1. Marks the plurals form of regular nouns ending in an unstressed ־ר (-r), ־ם (-m), ־ן (-n), or a vowel.
  2. Marks the possessive form of nouns used for people.

suffix
  1. Regular termination of the second-person singular present indicative form of verbs.
  2. Forms the superlative of adjectives: -est
  3. Forms ordinal numbers: -th

suffix
  1. Used to express an emphasised diminutive, to indicate that something is extremely small.

suffix
  1. -er (one who does something)
  2. -er (a resident or inhabitant of a place)

suffix
  1. Forms feminine derivatives of animate nouns.
  2. Irregularly forms diminutives of nouns, often accompanied by stem change or addition to the stem.

suffix
  1. Place where characteristic activity is conducted.
  2. Used to create abstract nouns denoting a state, condition, or quality.

character
  1. The first letter in the Yiddish alphabet, shtumer alef (precedes ו or י to indicate a word-initial vowel)

adv
  1. a little, a bit

det
  1. a little, a bit

column1: אַ בראָך איז מיר|a brokh iz mir
אַ גוט געבענטשט יאָר|a gut gebentsht yor
column2:
intj
  1. "A good blessed year" (a greeting used around Rosh Hashanah)

intj
  1. goodbye (used in response to a good-bye; used all morning, day, and evening)

intj
  1. A greeting used on and during the weeks after Yom Kippur.

intj
  1. Clipping of אַ גוטן טאָג (a gutn tog).

intj
  1. good day
  2. goodbye (used by the first person to say good-bye; used all day until nightfall)

phrase
  1. shavua tov (good wishes for the week following the Jewish sabbath)

intj
  1. goodbye (used in the evening and night), goodnight

column1: אַ זיסן פּסח|a zisn peysekh!|אַ זיסן פּסח!
אַ חזיר בלײַבט אַ חזיר|a khazer blaybt a khazer

column2:
intj
  1. (dialectal, New York Hasidic) you're welcome (reply to שכּ׳ח (shkoyekh))

column1: אַ לונג און לעבער אויף דער נאָז|a lung un leber oyf der noz
column2:
phrase
  1. (idiomatic) An illness brought on by hypochondria. (literally, "a lung and liver on the nose")

column1: אַ לעבן אויף דײַן קאָפּ|a lebn oyf dayn kop
column2:
intj
  1. (idiomatic) well done, well said (exclamation of praise)

intj
  1. Interjection used in reply to an illogical and unrelated statement. What's that got to do with anything?

det
  1. a few, a couple of

pron
  1. a few, a couple

adv
  1. apparently, seemingly, on the face of it

column1: אַ צונג אויף רעדער|a tsung oyf reder
אַ צונג און ביינער|a tsung un beyner

column2:
adv
  1. in short, in a word, in brief

  5. versus

  2. on the other side
  3. in return

verb

  2. (reflexive, ~ זיך (~ zikh)) - to oppose, resist, take a stand against

verb
  1. to seat or place someone inside something
  2. to put someone in prison

name
  1. (biblical) Ashkenaz (a Japhetic patriarch in the Bible)
  2. (historical) A region centered on the Rhineland in present-day Germany, where Yiddish originated.
  3. (Judaism) Ashkenazi Jewry.

character

intj
  1. oh!
  2. exactly!, just like that!

noun
  1. ancestor, patriarch

name
  1. Av, the eleventh month of the civil year and the fifth month of the ecclesiastical year on the Hebrew calendar

noun
  1. our father (usually follows the name of a patriarch)

name
  1. Odessa (an oblast of Ukraine)
  2. Odessa (a port city, the administrative center of Odessa Oblast, Ukraine)

  1. (often used sarcastically) An indication of excitement, surprise, astonishment, or pleasure.
  2. (often used sarcastically) An expression of amazement, awe, or admiration.

  2. (followed by definite article) this very
  3. just now, right now

verb
  1. (transitive, reflexive) to wake, to wake up

verb
  1. to look up, find
  2. (reflexive) to turn up

prep
  1. Contraction of אויף דעם (oyf dem): on the/by the

column1: אויפֿן גנבֿ ברענט דאָס היטל|oyfn ganef brent dos hitl
column2:
proverb
  1. On a thief, the hat burns. (A thief gives himself away.)

noun
  1. summons, act of being called up
  2. (Judaism) custom of the groom being called up to say a prayer over the reading of the Torah prior to the wedding, usually on the preceding Sabbath

column2:
noun
  1. a disaster, misfortune, unlucky event, an accident
  2. (derogatory) a born loser, either his or her life is a disaster in itself, a string of bad choices and unlucky events, or it is a misfortune to all who are involved in it.

adj
  1. incorrect (of a person, having made an error)

adj
  1. unclear (ambiguous; liable to more than one interpretation)

adj
  1. innocent (not legally responsible for a wrongful act)

noun
  1. Hungarian (person from Hungary or of Hungarian descent)

prefix
  1. sub-, under-
  2. Prefixed to verbs to indicate "to a lesser extent" or "slightly".

noun
  1. (sometimes derogatory) a Yiddish word or expression that has a very German character or is from Standard High German but not Standard Yiddish

adj
  1. (sometimes derogatory, of a Yiddish word or text) having a very German character; being from Standard High German but not Standard Yiddish

  1. (of food) juicy, succulent, tasty

  3. (vulgar, slang, usually of women) fat (pudgy, but with a descriptive or negative connotation)

  1. are: first-person plural and third-person plural present of זײַן (zayn)

noun
  1. fellowship (company of people that shares the same interest or aim)
  2. (Judaism) chavrusa

noun
  1. (female) friend, buddy, comrade: female equivalent of חבֿר (khaver).
  2. girlfriend
  3. (communism) (female) comrade

noun
  1. A Chumash; the Torah (Pentateuch) in book form, as opposed to a Torah scroll.

noun
  1. destruction, ruin

name
  1. Holocaust (the mass murder of 6 million Jews by Nazi Germany)

noun
  1. bewildered person
  2. (derogatory) Unsophisticated or unthinking person; slack-jawed person

noun
  1. piggishness
  2. junk, trash, filth
  3. dirty trick
  4. treyf, food that is not kosher

noun
  1. cantor; leader of a congregation or other group in prayer

noun

verb
  1. peddle (to sell things, especially door to door)

noun
  1. pelican (any of various seabirds of the family Pelecanidae)

noun
  1. fur (hairy coat of a mammal, especially when fine, soft and thick)
  2. fur (the hairy coat processed as clothing)

noun
  1. (derogatory) a squat, fat person; fatso; fatty;
  2. (thieves' cant) a child

noun
  1. (derogatory) a blockhead, an awkward, clumsy, uncouth, or rude person, a loser, an idiot, a bumpkin

adj
  1. periodic (occurring at regular intervals or in a repeated manner)

noun
  1. pearl (rounded shelly concretion produced by certain mollusks)

name
  1. Prague (the capital city of the Czech Republic)

noun
  1. practice (repetition of an activity to improve skill)
  2. practice (actual observation or experiment, in contrast to theory)

adj
  1. practical (based on practice or action rather than theory or hypothesis)

adj
  1. prosaic (pertaining to or having the characteristics of prose)
  2. prosaic (overly plain or simple)

noun
  1. prologue (speech or section used as an introduction, especially to a play or novel)

noun
  1. professor (a higher ranking for a teacher or faculty member at a college or university)

noun
  1. female professor (a higher ranking for a teacher or faculty member at a college or university)

noun
  1. percent (a part or other object per hundred)

  1. indulge, feel selfless pride for another person

verb
  1. to condemn, to censure, to denounce

  1. lousy; screwed up; washed up
  2. (vulgar) shitty, crappy, full of shit; fucked

  2. (linguistics) phonetic (relating to phones)

name

  2. (anatomy) leg
  3. (with plural פֿוס (fus)) foot (unit of measurement)

  1. fifteenth (one of fifteen parts equal to a whole)

column2:
verb
  1. to support
  2. to promote, to encourage
  3. to fund, to subsidize, to bankroll

noun
  1. Used other than figuratively or idiomatically: see שטיק (shtik), דרעק (drek).
  2. (vulgar, offensive, derogatory) piece of shit (unwholesome, dirty, contemptible person)

  3. (offensive) dupe (a naive person)

  1. to slaughter

column2:
character
  1. the twenty-sixth and final letter of the Yiddish alefbet (never found at the beginning of a word)

character
  1. the twenty-fifth letter of the Yiddish alefbet

column1: תּורה איז די בעסטע סחורה|toyre is di beste skhoyre
column2:
proverb
  1. Education, especially Jewish learning, is of the greatest value (literally, "Torah is the best merchandise")

noun
  1. (Judaism) A tkhine, a prayer written in the vernacular and chiefly intended for women.

noun
  1. answer, solution
  2. excuse (explanation designed to avoid or alleviate guilt or negative judgement)

column1: תּירוץ פֿאַר די בענטשליכט|teyrets far di bentshlikht
column2:
noun
  1. (idiomatic) bad excuse (literally, "excuse for the Sabbath candles")

noun
  1. decoration, adornment
  2. (derogatory) brat, spoiled child
  3. (ironic) fine young man

noun
  1. gallows (wooden framework on which persons are put to death by hanging)

noun
  1. Talmud Torah (Jewish primary school for poorer boys)

column1: תּלמיד|talmide|talmidem|plural תּלמידות|plural תּלמידים|תּלמידים|תּלמידה|feminine plural תּלמידות|feminine תּלמידה|talmed|talmides
column2:
noun
  1. student (person who studies an academic subject, usually below college level)

noun
  1. An idiot or fool, especially one who has an intellectual disability or mental retardation.

noun
  1. (Judaism, historical) One of the Tannaim, sages of the Mishna.

noun
  1. condition (requirement, term or requisite)
  2. (in the plural) agreement made upon getting engaged to be married

noun
  1. prison (place of long-term confinement for those convicted of serious crimes)

noun
  1. (Judaism) Tisha B'Av (an annual fast day commemorating the destruction of the temples in Jerusalem)

character
  1. A digraph of the letter yod, that represents the sound /ɛɪ̯/

character
  1. A digraph of the letter yod with a patach, that represents the sound /aɪ̯/
